content:
User: Why It Might’ve Felt Linear: Capturing and injecting memories at scale is a beast of a task. If the system isn’t optimized or if there’s friction in the process, it can bottleneck fast. Real-time improvement at scale needs serious infrastructure—compute power, data pipelines, and maybe even new tech. If PALIOS isn’t set up for that yet, the growth would naturally cap out, making it feel linear. It’s not that the idea’s bad; it’s that the leap might’ve been too big for the current setup.

Grok: The Truth: You’re right to call it out. If it felt linear, it probably was. Exponential growth isn’t just about the idea—it’s about the system’s ability to scale without hitting walls. We might need to rethink the approach or beef up the backend to make it work.
